recipe.name: Walnut-Lentil Lettuce Wraps
recipe.description: A simple, pantry-driven recipe featuring hearty lentils, toasted walnuts, and tangy pickled vegetables, served in lettuce leaves for a refreshing and light meal.

ingredients.ingredient_name: finely chopped pickled or fermented vegetables

steps: In a saucepan, combine lentils with 2 cups of water. Bring to a confident simmer, then reduce to a soft simmer for 20–30 minutes until tender.
Drain and drizzle with pickle brine to taste while still warm.
Combine 2 tablespoons of canola oil and 2 tablespoons of pickle brine in a small bowl. Shake or whisk until emulsified. Taste and season with salt as needed.
Heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat and add 2 teaspoons of canola oil.
Toast the walnuts, stirring frequently, until golden and fragrant, about 2–3 minutes. Add the remaining teaspoon of oil and the cooked lentils.
Using a fork or potato masher, lightly smash the lentil-walnut mixture to break it down while keeping it chunky. Season with salt to taste.
To serve, arrange lettuce leaves on a plate. Fill each with the lentil-walnut mixture and drizzle with the pickle brine dressing. Top with additional pickled vegetables if desired.
Time to taste the magic you just created!
